meanings.definition: A person or thing that throbs.
meanings.sent1: The engine in the old car was a throbber, making a rhythmic noise.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the throbber of the music in my chest at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The throbber of the drum set kept the beat for the entire band.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced like a throbber in a race car, full of energy.
meanings.sent5: The throbber of the waterfall was so loud, it drowned out all other sounds.

meanings.sent1: The throbber of the bass in the music made the floor vibrate.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the throbber of excitement in her chest before the big announcement.
meanings.sent3: The throbber of the alarm clock woke him up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The throbber of the thunderstorm outside matched the pounding of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The throbber of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: A graphic element on a computer screen that indicates a loading process.
meanings.sent1: The throbber on the screen spun around as the file downloaded.
meanings.sent2: I stared at the throbber, waiting for the webpage to load.
meanings.sent3: The throbber on the screen seemed to mock me as it took forever to finish loading.
meanings.sent4: The throbber on the screen was like a digital heartbeat, pulsing with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The throbber on the screen was a constant reminder of the slow internet connection.
